titles.ar: باب مَتَى يَجِبُ عَلَى الْجَارِيَةِ الْقِنَاعُ
titles.en: Chapter 169 – When is the scarf Obligatory upon the girl

titles.ar: باب مَا يَحِلُّ لِلْمَمْلُوكِ النَّظَرُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ مَوْلَاتِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 167 – What is Permissible for the slaves to look at from his mistress

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/369)

narrator_chain.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ عُتْبَةَ النَّخَعِيِّ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ أُمِّ الْوَلَدِ هَلْ يَصْلُحُ أَنْ يَنْظُرَ إِلَيْهَا خَصِيُّ مَوْلَاهَا وَ هِيَ تَغْتَسِلُ قَالَ لَا يَحِلُّ ذَلِكَ .

en.hubeali: Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Muhammad, from Abdullah Bin Jabala, from Abdul Malik Bin Utba Al Nakhaie who said,
‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about a mother of the child, is it correct that a eunuch looks at his mistress and she is bathing’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘That is not Permissible’.
en.sarwar: 1. Humayd ibn Ziyad has narrated from al-Hassan ibn Muhammad from ‘Abd Allah ibn Jabalah from ‘Abd al-Malik ibn ‘Utbah from al- Nakha’iy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a castrated slave; if he can look at his mistress when she takes a bath. He (the Imam) said, ‘No, it is not lawful.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (20/369)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) قُلْتُ يَكُونُ لِلرَّجُلِ الْخَصِيُّ يَدْخُلُ عَلَى نِسَائِهِ فَيُنَاوِلُهُنَّ الْوَضُوءَ فَيَرَى شُعُورَهُنَّ قَالَ لَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muhammad Bin Is’haq who said,

‘I asked Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup> saying, ‘The man happens to have a eunuch for him, who enters upon his womenfolk, so he gives them (water for) the ablution, so he sees their hair’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Muhammad ibn Ishaq who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a man who has a castrated slave; if he can go to his women and provide them water for wudu and look at their hairs. He (the Imam) said, ‘No, he can do so.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (20/369)

narrator_chain.text: 3- عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا (عَلَيْهِ السَّلام) عَنْ قِنَاعِ الْحَرَائِرِ مِنَ الْخِصْيَانِ فَقَالَ كَانُوا يَدْخُلُونَ عَلَى بَنَاتِ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ السَّلام) وَلا يَتَقَنَّعْنَ قُلْتُ فَكَانُوا أَحْرَاراً قَالَ لا قُلْتُ فَالأحْرَارُ يُتَقَنَّعُ مِنْهُمْ قَالَ لا.

en.sarwar: 3. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn ‘Isma’il ibn Bazi’ who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, al-Rida’, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the veil of the free women before castrated ones. He (the Imam) said, ‘They would go in the presence of the daughters of abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, and they would not use veils.’ I then asked if they were free. He (the Imam) said, ‘No, they were not free.’ I then asked, ‘Is veil necessary the free ones before them (castrated) ones?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘No, it is not so.’”
